results.title: Original sin
results.creator_credit: Tom Shandel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
A troubadour sings his song while the camera pans in on individuals in the audience. The song is called Original Sin.

results.title: Origin of the motion picture
results.brief_description: An historical record of the development of the machinery and arts of the motion picture, from the earliest suggestions of Leonardo da Vinci to the perfected sound motion picture of Edison. Scenes as early as 1880 are included and reference is made to the work of Plateau, Daguerre, Muybridge, Marey, Edison, Armat, Dickson and others.

results.title: Origin of life on earth
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith, ONF | NFB and Kenneth Horn

results.title: Origin of land plants: liverworts and mosses
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 2. Plant life”.
Traces the evolution of land plants and illustrates the structural characteristics, reproductive processes and adaptive mechanisms of liverworts and mosses. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Origami: the folding papers of Japan
results.brief_description: Japanese children demonstrate the ancient art of origami, decorative paper folding. Many beautiful and complex designs can be created by working iwth a simple square of paper. Flowers, animals, birds and other things appear magically from the dextrous fingers of the children.
results.description: Japanese children demonstrate the ancient art of origami, decorative paper folding. Many beautiful and complex designs can be created by working iwth a simple square of paper. Flowers, animals, birds and other things appear magically from the dextrous fingers of the children.

results.title: Origami
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Joan Hanson
results.brief_description: The Japanese art of paper folding, as practised both by skilled fingers and the less-adept hands of children. That anyone can learn and experiment, and take pleasure from the results, is evident from the variety of shapes and figures being conjured out of colored paper.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Verrall, ONF | NFB and Joan Hanson

results.title: Orienteering: family, fun and fitness
results.brief_description: Explains what is involved in the sport of orienteering. The film shows the organisation and running of a large international orienteering competition. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Orienteering
results.brief_description: Explains the sport of orienteering in which contestants must travel a course as quickly as possible, choosing the routes by map and compass. Shows scenes from the first Canadian orienteering championship in Guelph, Ontario. Suitable for upper primary level.
